job_title: Valet Attendant in Little Rock, AR
pros: Nice Interview Process on the front end
cons: HR will run your background. If they find anything, anywhere, including unsubstiated rumors, even from sources that say “not an official document”, they will refuse to employ you. They will not give an opportunity for appeal or to prove said information is incorrect. They will also refuse to provide you with the information they used against you. (I have a subpoena duces tecum and subpoenas for appearances in court for HR over this matter about to be served upon them. I hope the judge educates them about proper adult behavior, and what “not an official document” means, as well as giving people the right to appeal.) The CEO also refuses to meet with people to discuss these matters and allow for clarification.

job_title: Management in Little Rock, AR

Some locations are visibly pleasing...some are in need of a total renovation
Patients are mostly appreciative
Top of the line technology
Radiation Oncologists were fantastic to work with
cons:
Medical Oncologists acted like dictators of their own kingdom
Long time employees played management against the doctors for their own benefit
"Good old boy" mentality towards processes and compliance with laws/regulations
Might need to pull the knife out of your back when interacting with peers
Claims to be a non-profit; focused on generating revenue and expansion, not a quality patient experience. My theory is the CEO is building up a golden parachute to sell off.
